item.title: What is Dynasty Warriors Origins’ Metacritic Score?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/what-is-dynasty-warriors-origins-metacritic-score/

Dynasty Warriors Origins is out, which means its Metacritic score is available. The hack-and-slash franchise has nearly 30 years of developing and publishing mileage on the clock, so let’s see if Origins has managed to land its biggest killing blow yet.

Dynasty Warriors 10 was canceled before it was ever shown to the public. Instead, we got Dynasty Warriors Origins, one of January 2025’s hottest games. Origins features an unbelievable amount of soldiers on screen and more of the classic action that’s helped the series to ship over 20 million copies and counting.

As with any game’s release, reviews are everything. In today’s social-media-heavy society, review embargos are paramount. Everyone is desperate to know how a new title is received by critics, helping to sway people in their decision to buy it. Dynasty Warriors Origins’ reviews are out, so let’s dive into its final scores.

Dynasty Warriors Origins has a score of 80 out of 100 on Metacritic.

Individually, Origin rates 85 out of 100 for PC based on 18 reviews, 80 on PS5 using 48 reviews, and 78 on Xbox—taking into account 10 reviews.

Origins’ Metacritic page is the source for all the information we’ve collated. I find the best way to aggregate a game is the review score with the most quantitative verdicts, and in this case, it’s the PlayStation 5’s 80/100 score.

The Xbox’s number is only based on 10 reviews, so it’s hard to gauge this figure properly. A score of 80 out of 100 is a very good result for Dynasty Warriors—but more on this later.

Dynasty Warriors Origins Opencritic Score Explained

Dynasty Warriors Origins has a combined score of 82 out of 100—based on 62 reviews—on OpenCritic, with an “80% Critics Recommend” percentage.

OpenCritic considers more reviewers than Metacritic and is considered to be a more versatile source of reviews and opinions. It also doesn’t split up platforms and takes the best from each format for one averaged-out rating.

How Do Dynasty Warriors Origins Reviews Compare?

Dynasty Warriors Origins is the highest-rated game in the franchise’s history!

Using Metacritic, and without historical data for 1997’s very first Dynasty Warriors, I can tell you Origins’ main Metacritic score of 80 out of 100 is a record high. Dynasty Warriors 3 and 4 are the closest competitors with a rating of 78 out of 100—so congratulations to Dynasty Warriors Origins for being the best yet.

Here’s a quick look at how every other DW title compares to Origins from a Metacritic standpoint.

Are you happy to see Dynasty Warriors Origins get a Metacritic score akin to its formative years? Tell us your favorite memories of playing Dynasty Warriors growing up.

Check out the combat for Origins if you haven’t as it looks jaw-dropping.

item.title: Fortnite’s Godzilla Transformation Mythic Will Arrive This Friday, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/fortnite-godzilla-transformation-mythic/

According to a new leak, players will be able to transform into Godzilla in Fortnite thanks to a new mythic coming this Friday. 

Spotted by TheGamer, reliable leaker HYPEX has revealed that Fortnite is receiving a Godzilla transformation mythic this Friday, January 17. The new mythic will allow players to transform into Giant Godzillas and wreak havoc across the islands with their monstrous abilities. When transformed, players can use skills like Beam, Stomp, Roar, and more. Additionally, a “throw banana” ability has been spotted in the files, which is believed to be a Kong mythic. 

Godzilla descended onto Fortnite Island yesterday, marking the start of the Godzilla X Kong collaboration. We have already seen the Japanese kaiju make an appearance on the island, and it’s just a matter of time before King Kong from Skull Island shows up, too. If the Kong mythic does show up, there will be some interesting Godzilla vs Kong matchups that players can experience this season. 

Talking about Fortnite and Godzilla, another leak by HYPEX has revealed that Mechagodzilla has been confirmed for the game, too. The shop text description for this item stated, “B.E.A.S.T. Glove Emote utilizes different sounds when equipped with Mechagodzilla or Godzilla.” 

In other news, Hatsune Miku’s skin leaked online before Fortnite Festival Season 7. Also, here’s how many players that play the game in 2025. What are your thoughts on Fortnite’s Godzilla Mythic? Let us know in the comments below or on our community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about Starfield developer revealing why gore was cut from the game, and don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Sega’s New Trademark Could Be the Secret Game at Xbox Developer Direct
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/segas-new-trademark-could-be-the-secret-game-at-xbox-developer-direct/

SEGA’s trademarks for “Ecco the Dolphin” and “Ecco” went public today, and players believe this could be the surprise game at the upcoming Xbox Developer Direct. 

Spotted on r/GamingLeaksAndRumours, a post on X by Gematsu revealed that on December 27, 2024, SEGA filed trademarks for “Ecco the Dolphin” and “Ecco” in Japan, and this information was made public today. Players believe that this could be the secret game at Xbox Developer Direct as it matches the description of being an iconic Japanese IP with a lot of history. 

A few days ago, Xbox revealed that a Developer Direct is scheduled for January 23, 2025, during which they will reveal more details about South of Midnight, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, DOOM: The Dark Ages, and a secret game. Right after the announcement, a report claimed that the secret title would be “a new entry in a legendary Japanese IP which has decades of history. ” Players speculate that this IP is none other than Ecco the Dolphin. 

Ecco the Dolphin is a video game series created by Ed Annunziata for the Sega Genesis console. In this game, you play the role of a bottlenose dolphin called Ecco, who is searching the vast ocean for his missing pod. The series received several instalments until 2000, including Ecco: The Tides of Time, Ecco Jr., and more. However, the franchise has been dormant since then. 

It’ll be interesting to see if SEGA’s new trademark is indeed Xbox’s secret title. However, we will have to wait for an official announcement to know for sure. 

In other news, a recent report stated that Sega could be working on a new game subscription service. Also, two Xbox exclusives might be coming to Nintendo Switch 2. What are your thoughts on SEGA’s new trademark? Is it Xbox’s secret title? Let us know in the comments below or on our community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about Starfield developer revealing why gore was cut from the game, and don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: When is the DICE Summit 2025 And Who Are The Nominations For The DICE Awards?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/when-is-the-dice-summit-2025-and-nominations-for-dice-awards/

When is the DICE Summit 2025, and who are this year’s nominations for the DICE Awards?

The DICE (Design, Innovate, Communicate, Entertain) Summit is an annual event where the video game industry’s leading minds come together to share and explore creative processes. DICE 2025 is set to take place between February 11 – February 13 this year, with its price pass costing attendees $3350.

The DICE Awards will also take place during the event, starting on February 13th at 8PM PT.

DICE Awards 2025 Nominations

This year’s DICE Awards will be hosted by Kinda Funny Games founder Greg Miller and award-winning media personality Stella Chung. As like most Award shows, the DICE Summit will have the likes of ‘Game of the Year’, ‘Outstanding Achievement in Art Direction’, ‘Action of The Year’ and more. The nominations for the DICE Awards are:

Outstanding Achievement in Animation

  • Astro Bot
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
  • FINAL FANTASY VII REBIRTH
  • Neva
  • Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

Outstanding Achievement in Art Direction

  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • LEGO Horizon Adventures
  • The Plucky Squire
  • Senua’s Saga: Hellblade 2

Outstanding Achievement in Character

  • 1000xRESIST – Watcher
  • FINAL FANTASY VII REBIRTH – Yuffie Kisaragi
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle – Dr. Henry “Indiana” Jones
  • INDIKA – Indika
  • Senua’s Saga: Hellblade II – Senua

Outstanding Achievement in Original Music Composition

  • Astro Bot
  • Helldivers 2
  • Monument Valley 3
  • Senua’s Saga: Hellblade II
  • Star Wars Outlaws

Outstanding Achievement in Audio Design

  • Frostpunk 2
  • Helldivers 2
  • Monument Valley 3
  • Senua’s Saga: Hellblade II
  • Still Wakes the Deep

Outstanding Achievement in Story

  • 1000xRESIST
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio
  • Still Wakes the Deep
  • Thank Goodness You’re Here!

Outstanding Achievement in Story

  • Astro Bot
  • Batman: Arkham Shadow
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • Senua’s Saga: Hellblade II
  • Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

Action Game of the Year

  • Batman: Arkham Shadow
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
  • Helldivers 2
  • Stellar Blade

Adventure Game of the Year

  • 1000xRESIST
  • ANIMAL WELL
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom
  • Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown

Family Game of the Year

  • Astro Bot
  • Cat Quest III
  • Little Kitty, Big City
  • The Plucky Squire
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree

Fighting Game of the Year

  • Blazing Strike
  • DRAGON BALL: Sparking! ZERO
  • Mortal Kombat 1: Khaos Reigns
  • TEKKEN 8
  • UNDERDOGS

Racing Game of the Year

  • F1® 24
  • MotoGP™24
  • NIGHT-RUNNERS™ PROLOGUE

Role-Playing Game of the Year

  • FINAL FANTASY VII REBIRTH
  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard
  • ELDEN RING: Shadow of the Erdtree
  • Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio

Sports Game of the Year

  • EA SPORTS College Football 25
  • EA SPORTS FC 25
  • MLB The Show 24
  • NBA 2K25

Strategy/Simulation Game of the Year

  • Balatro
  • Caves of Qud
  • Frostpunk 2
  • Tactical Breach Wizards
  • Satisfactory

Immersive Reality Technical Achievement

  • Alien: Rogue Incursion
  • Batman: Arkham Shadow
  • Skydance’s BEHEMOTH
  • Starship Home
  • UNDERDOGS

Immersive Reality Game of the Year

  • Alien: Rogue Incursion
  • Batman: Arkham Shadow
  • Escaping Wonderland
  • Skydance’s BEHEMOTH
  • UNDERDOGS

Outstanding Achievement for an Independent Game

  • ANIMAL WELL
  • Balatro
  • Grunn
  • INDIKA
  • Mouthwashing

Mobile Game of the Year

  • Balatro
  • Halls of Torment
  • Monument Valley 3
  • Paper Trail
  • Wuthering Waves

Online Game of the Year

  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
  • Diablo IV: Vessel of Hatred
  • Helldivers 2
  • Marvel Rivals
  • Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

Outstanding Achievement in Game Design

  • ANIMAL WELL
  • Astro Bot
  • Balatro
  • Helldivers 2
  • UFO 50

Outstanding Achievement in Game Direction

  • 1000xRESIST
  • ANIMAL WELL
  • Lorelei and the Laser Eyes
  • Riven
  • Thank Goodness You’re Here!

Game of the Year

  • Astro Bot
  • Balatro
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Helldivers 2
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle

In addition to the DICE Awards and behind-the-scenes talks, dozens of speakers will also be taking to the stage at the event to talk about various discussions around video games.

DICE Summit 2025 Speakers

The DICE Summit 2025 will have dozens of speakers at the event, including:

Richard Browne
Director
Blue Moon Production Company

Roundtable Leader

Owen Rees

Group Head of Licensing
Games Workshop
Roundtable Leader

Who do you think will win the DICE Awards? You can discuss DICE Summit 2025 in more detail on the Insider Gaming forums.
